metadata.title: CVE-2023-46847 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Squid is vulnerable to a Denial of Service, where a remote attacker canperform buffer overflow attack by writing up to 2 MB of arbitrary data toheap memory when Squid is configured to accept HTTP Digest Authentication.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-46847` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squid - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-cgi - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-common - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-openssl - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squid-purge - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
squidclient - 5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: squid package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.7-0ubuntu0.22.04.2').
